0.title: Breath analyser test to resume for all airline crew from Oct 15
0.article_body: Aviation regulator Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has issued guidelines to resume breath analyser tests for pilots and cabin crew from October 15. It said the decision has been taken in view of falling COVID-19 cases and an increase in the volume of air traffic. Breath analyser test was limited to 50% of the aircraft personnel during the pandemic.

1.title: Kartavya Path to have 90 ice cream carts, 30 water vending machines: NDMC
1.article_body: Newly christened Kartavya Path will have 90 ice cream carts and 30 water vending machines at six vending locations, NDMC said on Wednesday. "Each vending zone can have a maximum of 15 ice cream trolleys and five water dispensing kiosks," said New Delhi Municipal Council Vice Chairman Satish Upadhyay. This is for effective management of kiosks, he added.

2.title: Taxi and autorickshaw strike called off in Mumbai
2.article_body: The autorickshaw and taxi strike, scheduled to take place in Mumbai from September 15, has been called off for now, Mumbai Taximen's Union leader AL Quadros said. This comes after union leaders met state Industries Minister Uday Samant. Quadros said that Samant assured the leaders that a decision on their demands including fare hikes would be taken within 10 days.

3.title: India responds to Islamic group's remarks on J&K, says 'factually incorrect references'
3.article_body: India rejected "factually incorrect" references on J&K in a recent statement by Organisation of Islamic Cooperation and denounced Pakistan's attempts to use the platform against India. Accusing Pakistan of "peddling malicious propaganda", India said Islamabad is "well-advised to put its own house in order". "Pakistan has abysmal record on...protection of human rights of its people," India added.

4.title: WhatsApp releases ability to hide 'online' status to some beta users: Report
4.article_body: WhatsApp is releasing the ability to hide 'online' status for some beta users through the Android 2.22.20.9 update, WABetaInfo reported. The feature can be accessed through the 'Privacy' section under 'Account' settings. Users will get the option of making their 'online' status visible to everyone or to those contacts who can see the user's 'last seen' status.

5.title: Woman,13-yr-old son found hanging in B'luru, police suspect suicide
5.article_body: A 48-year-old woman and her 13-year-old son were found dead at their house in Karnataka's Hosaguddadahalli. The information was received around 2:15 pm at the limits of Byatarayanapura police station, said Laxman B Nimbargi, DCP, West Bengaluru. The DCP added that the reason for the "suicide" is yet to be ascertained and they are looking into the matter.

6.title: Delhi govt school staffers assault DD News journalist, break camera
6.article_body: An FIR has been registered against staffers of a Delhi government school after a DD News journalist alleged that he and his colleagues were assaulted and their camera was broken at the school. A case has also been registered on the complaint of a school teacher, who alleged that the journalist forcefully entered the school and assaulted staffers, police said.

7.title: Bengaluru Police seize 506 kg of ganja valued at over ₹2 crore
7.article_body: Bengaluru Police have seized 506 kg of ganja, worth over ₹2 crore, after receiving a tip-off, officials said. The contraband was seized earlier in the week near the Kempambudhi Lake in south Bengaluru after officials received information that a drug consignment from Malkangiri region of Odisha had reached the city. Five persons have been arrested in the case.

8.title: Latest T20I team rankings announced, India remain on top
8.article_body: The ICC today released the latest men's T20I team rankings, with India remaining on top with 268 rating points. Meanwhile, Pakistan, who lost the Asia Cup 2022 final to Sri Lanka, have slipped to the fourth position from the second position. Asia Cup 2022 winners Sri Lanka are ranked eighth with 237 rating points.

9.title: Scene I shared with Irrfan in 'Angrezi...' is precious to me: Pankaj
9.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi has said that late actor Irrfan Khan inspired him to become an actor. "Irrfan sahab was very dear to me...That one sequence that I shared with him in 'Angrezi Medium' is very precious to me," he added. 'Angrezi Medium' was Irrfan's last film. Pankaj recently featured in 'Sherdil: The Pilibhit Saga'.

10.title: Earth barrelling towards uncharted territory of destruction: WMO report
10.article_body: Citing a report by World Meteorological Organization, UN chief António Guterres said climate change is leading "Earth towards uncharted territory of destruction". Weather, climate, and water-related disasters have increased by a factor of 5 over 50 years, the report stated. Europe's heatwave, Pakistan's floods and China's droughts are the price of humanity's fossil fuel addiction, Guterres said.

11.title: I've hardly slept in the last six months: Byju's CEO on company's troubles
11.article_body: Byju Raveendran, the Co-founder and CEO of India's most valued edtech startup Byju's, told Moneycontrol, "The last six months have been tough, like I've hardly slept." His statement comes after questions were raised over the company's aggressive sales practices, delay in its FY21 annual report and layoffs. "It can't be tougher than this," he added.

12.title: Few passengers injured as smoke emerged from Express flight in Muscat: Air India
12.article_body: Air India said some of the 145 passengers on board its Express flight to Kochi suffered minor bruises during the evacuation process after smoke started coming out of the plane at Muscat International Airport on Wednesday. The airline, however, added that no major injuries were reported. The passengers included four infants.

13.title: Will you fire his also: Assam CM to Congress over Nehru's pic in shorts
13.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday shared an image of former PM Jawaharlal Nehru wearing shorts and captioned it, "Will you fire his also..." This comes after Congress on Monday shared an image of a pair of khaki shorts on fire. Nehru, however, is not wearing the RSS khaki shorts but the uniform of Congress' Seva Dal.

14.title: Fear has returned to Bihar, there's mis-governance: BJP on Begusarai firing
14.article_body: BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad on Wednesday criticised Bihar CM Nitish Kumar over firing in Begusarai and said that fear has returned to the state, adding that there's mis-governance. Prasad alleged that everyone, including investors, is unhappy with the state of affairs there. "What has happened to you Nitish Kumar ji in the company of your new friends," Prasad said.

15.title: 7 policemen suspended after mass shooting in Bihar's Begusarai
15.article_body: A day after two gunmen opened fire in Bihar's Begusarai district killing one and injuring 11 people, seven police personnel were suspended for the lapse in duty, an official said. Begusarai SP Yogendra Kumar said five people have been detained since last night and questioning is underway. "Teams [are] raiding neighbouring districts at all suspected spots," Kumar said.

16.title: Indian chips can reduce laptop cost from ₹1 lakh to ₹40,000: Vedanta Chairman
16.article_body: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal said that once the glass and semiconductor chip is available in India, a ₹1 lakh laptop can cost ₹40,000 or less. His statement comes after Vedanta announced its new semiconductor plant with Foxconn will be set up in Gujarat. "We'll not be manufacturing laptops, mobile phones...but we'll create a cluster to encourage manufacturers," said Agarwal.

17.title: Was insecure about Jackie Shroff's success in early days: Anil Kapoor
17.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor, during his appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', revealed he was insecure about Jackie Shroff's success in his initial days. "Until I signed a Yash Chopra film, I felt like an outsider even though I wasn't one," he added. Anil further said that he felt the same way when actors Sanjay Dutt and Sunny Deol were launched.

18.title: Video shows youth sitting on bonnet, others leaning out from car in Gr Noida
18.article_body: A video showing a group of youngsters performing stunts on cars and bikes in Greater Noida in Uttar Pradesh has gone viral on social media. In the video, while one person is seen sitting on the bonnet of the vehicle, the others are seen leaning out from the car. A person riding a bike is also seen removing his t-shirt.

19.title: Mumbai's Kemps Corner Bridge opens for vehicles after brief closure
19.article_body: The Kemps Corner Bridge in South Mumbai was briefly closed for vehicular movement on Wednesday due to a technical issue. "Commuters can take the August Kranti Maidan - [Haji Ali] - Wilson College - Nana Chowk route," Mumbai Traffic Police tweeted shortly after 3:00 pm. Within an hour, police said that the bridge has opened for vehicular movement.

20.title: Piyush Goyal chairs meeting of newly reconstituted Board of Trade
20.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday chaired the first meeting of the newly reconstituted Board of Trade. During the meeting, Goyal stressed on the need to enter into more FTAs with developed nations, urging participants to focus on the possibilities each sector has in FTAs. Twenty-nine new non-official members were invited for the first time in this meeting.

21.title: Not us: BJP after men set police vehicle on fire during Nabanna protest
21.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra accused BJP of resorting to violence during the protest rally at West Bengal Secretariat 'Nabanna' after a few men were seen setting a police vehicle on fire. Denying such allegations, BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari said that the "police may have done it themselves". TMC's jihadis came and carried out the violence, he added.

22.title: 6 people booked in Hyderabad for illegal water connections
22.article_body: Officials of Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply & Sewerage Board (HMWSSB) have booked six people in the city for illegally obtaining water connections. The accused were illegally obtaining water from the water board pipelines in Bhagat Singh Nagar, Chinthal, a police officer investigating the case said. The case was booked under sections 269 and 430 of the Indian Penal Code.

23.title: Hindi is friend of regional languages, not competitor: Amit Shah
23.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah denounced the disinformation campaign pitting Hindi against other languages and said that Hindi is not a competitor to all regional languages, but rather a "friend". He added that regional languages in the country can prosper only when Hindi prospers, and vice versa. Amit Shah further stressed the need for languages to co-exist.

24.title: Karnataka HC to hear pleas on BBMP delimitation on September 21
24.article_body: The Karnataka High Court will hear petitions on the delimitation of wards of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on September 21. The State Election Commission (SEC) had earlier submitted that the revised electoral list would be released on September 22. The number of wards is proposed to be increased from 198 to 243.

25.title: Google loses challenge against EU antitrust decision, wins fine cut
25.article_body: The General Court agreed with the European Union's anti-trust regulators' claim that Google had abused its dominance and used its Android mobile operating system to impose unlawful restrictions on manufacturers and mobile network operators. However, because of a disagreement on one point, the fine imposed on Google was cut by 5%. It now has to pay a €4.125 billion fine.

26.title: Pune building sold, bought 20 times in a year without owners' knowledge
26.article_body: A four-storeyed residential property in Pune was reportedly bought, sold or mortgaged about 20 times in the last one year without the knowledge of the owners. The building is owned by four women. Police said the fraud involved unidentified women posing as the property's owners. The accused allegedly paid ₹18.72 lakh towards government stamp duties for three different mortgage deeds.

27.title: DHL Supply Chain will invest 500 mn euros in India over 5 years
27.article_body: To expand its warehousing capacity, workforce and sustainability initiatives, logistics provider DHL Supply Chain will invest 500 million euros in India over the next five years. The company will expand by adding 12-million square feet of warehousing capacity in metro cities such as Bangalore, Chennai, Kolkata, Mumbai, NCR and Pune. By 2026, it also plans to double its India workforce.

28.title: Mumbai police officer held for abusing, assaulting female colleague
28.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested an assistant police inspector (API), 49-year-old Deepak Baburao Deshmukh, from Kurar Police Station for allegedly abusing, assaulting and molesting a woman police inspector of the same department. According to the police sources, the accused was in a one-sided love affair with the victim. Despite being transferred to another department, he continued to harass the victim.

29.title: Drug smuggling racket busted in Hyd; 360 kg marijuana seized, 6 held
29.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Wednesday busted an interstate drug smuggling racket, seized 360 kg of marijuana and arrested six persons in connection with the case. Three cars, eight mobile phones and ₹10,000 cash, worth a total of ₹1.2 crore were seized from them, police said. The main accused in the case hails from Andhra Pradesh's East Godavari district, police added.

30.title: SC allows BCCI to amend constitution, clears way for extension of Ganguly, Shah's terms
30.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly and Secretary Jay Shah are set to continue for another term after the Supreme Court allowed the BCCI to amend its constitution. The apex court said that an office-bearer need not go into cooling off after one term at the state and BCCI levels. It allowed two consecutive terms each at both levels.

31.title: Had reservations about my role, but couldn't say no: Ileana on 'Barfi'
31.article_body: Celebrating 10 years of 'Barfi', actress Ileana D'Cruz said that even though she had reservations about how her role would turn out, she couldn't say no to the film. She said 'Barfi' had "soul in it" and it was a film that she knew she'd never get again. "It's the one film I genuinely gave my heart to," she added.

32.title: Maha man swept away with bike as he tries crossing flooded bridge
32.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a man trying to cross a flooded bridge on his motorbike in Maharashtra's Akola. The man was seen losing control of the vehicle, following which he was swept away by the swollen river along with his bike. A group of people were seen watching the incident. The man was reportedly saved and is alive.

33.title: Man dies days after road accident involving stray dog in Kerala
33.article_body: A 25-year-old man died days after he was injured in a road accident involving a stray dog in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram. The accident occurred after the canine jumped before a vehicle in front of his bike. The victim fell from his bike and sustained injuries on his head. He underwent an emergency surgery at a private hospital but didn't survive.

34.title: Case filed against Ajay Devgn's 'Thank God' for hurting religious sentiments
34.article_body: A case has been filed against filmmaker Indra Kumar's upcoming film, 'Thank God', starring Ajay Devgn and Sidharth Malhotra for hurting religious sentiments. The case was filed by lawyer Himanshu Srivastava in Uttar Pradesh's Jaunpur court. Devgn plays the role of Chitragupta, a Hindu deity, in the movie which also features Nora Fatehi and Rakul Preet Singh.

35.title: Have become bigger fan of Madhuri after working with her: 'Maja Ma' director
35.article_body: Director Anand Tiwari said he has become a "bigger fan" of Madhuri Dixit after directing her in his upcoming film 'Maja Ma'. "Everything I know about films and storytelling is thanks to artists like her," he wrote. Stating that he has learned a lot from her, Anand said he "can't thank her enough for making this film her own".

36.title: Saker, Hussey join England's coaching staff for 2022 T20 WC
36.article_body: Former Australian cricketers David Saker and Michael Hussey have joined England's coaching staff as consultants for the upcoming T20 World Cup, the ECB has announced. Saker, who was England's bowling coach from 2010 to 2015, will join the Matthew Mott-led English coaching staff for their seven-match T20I series against Pakistan. Hussey will join during the World Cup.

37.title: Google to face most of Texas' lawsuit over ad dominance: Judge
37.article_body: A federal judge ruled that Google will have to face most antitrust allegations about its online advertising dominance brought in a lawsuit by attorneys general for Texas and 16 other states. The Alphabet Inc company, however, won a motion to dismiss an allegation that a cooperation deal it struck with Facebook in 2018 was an unlawful restraint of trade.

38.title: EV charging US-based startup TeraWatt raises $1 bn in Series A round
38.article_body: San Francisco-based electric vehicle charging startup TeraWatt Infrastructure has raised $1 billion in its Series A funding round. Existing investors Keyframe Capital and Cyrus Capital participated and Vision Ridge Partners also joined the latest funding round. TeraWatt plans to use the funds to expand a network of charging centres focused on EV fleet customers, the company said in a statement.

39.title: 1st direct flight from South India to Australia takes off from B'luru today
39.article_body: Australian carrier Qantas is operating its first direct flight from Bengaluru to Sydney on Wednesday, making it the first direct flight from South India to Australia. QF68 will take off from Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport around 6:35 pm and the duration of the flight is around 11 hours. Seats were sold out on day one, reports said.

40.title: Tata Power arm gets ₹596 crore LoA for solar project in MP
40.article_body: Tata Power Solar Systems Limited got a letter of award (LoA) worth ₹596 crore from NHDC Limited for setting up a 125 MW floating solar project in Madhya Pradesh. Bids were invited for the project to be set up at the Omkareshwar reservoir in Madhya Pradesh's Khandwa. NHDC is a joint venture of NHPC Limited and Madhya Pradesh government.

41.title: Byju's losses surge nearly 17 times to ₹4,588 crore in FY21, posts 14% revenue drop
41.article_body: Byju's recorded a ₹4,588 crore loss in FY21, nearly 17 times the ₹262 crore loss in FY20, revealed the FY21 results. The company's revenue fell 14% year-on-year to ₹2,428 crore on a consolidated basis, down from ₹2,704 crore the previous year. It said almost 40% of its revenue in FY21 was deferred to subsequent years due to new accounting practices.

42.title: 19-year-old Pune girl found dead, her friend jumps off building as body was being moved
42.article_body: Two 19-year-old childhood friends allegedly died by suicide in Pune within two hours. Sanika Bhagwat was found dead at her home and her friend Akansha Gaikwad reached there when the police was conducting probe. When Bhagwat's body was being taken in the ambulance, Gaikwad went to the terrace of the five-floor building and jumped to her death, police said.

43.title: BJP will have to pay for comments on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Ashok Gehlot
43.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said the Congress party's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is getting an overwhelming response from the public. "BJP people are worried and making comments. The more they will comment on the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', the more price they will have to pay," Gehlot added. Congress launched its 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Kanniyakumari on September 7.

44.title: WB has turned into a 'lawless, bankrupt' state under Mamata: BJP
44.article_body: BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad on Wednesday said that West Bengal has become a "lawless and bankrupt state" under CM Mamata Banerjee's leadership. He was reacting to the violence that erupted during the BJP's protest march to the state secretariat 'Nabanna' on Tuesday. Mamata talks about saving democracy but has crossed all limits of violation of democratic rights, he said.

45.title: 'Operation Lotus' fails in Delhi & Punjab, succeeds in Goa: AAP MP
45.article_body: AAP MP Raghav Chadha on Wednesday said "Operation Lotus" failed in Delhi and Punjab but succeeded in Goa. His statement came as eight Goa Congress MLAs joined BJP today. "When you vote for Congress, you elect a future BJP MLA. Congress is over, resting in pieces," Chadha tweeted. Meanwhile, Goa CM Pramod Sawant said that the MLAs joined BJP unconditionally.

46.title: PM condoles loss of lives in J&K accident, announces ex-gratia
46.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has condoled the loss of lives after 11 people were killed when a bus they were travelling in met with an accident in J&K's Poonch. He's announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for the families of the deceased and ₹50,000 compensation for those injured. The bus reportedly skidded off the road and plunged into a gorge.

47.title: CBI arrests ex-Andhra YSR Congress Party MP Geetha Kothapalli in PNB cheating case
47.article_body: CBI arrested former YSR Congress Party MP from Andhra Pradesh's Araku seat, Geetha Kothapalli, in connection with a bank cheating case. CBI had filed a charge-sheet in 2015 against Geetha and her husband for allegedly defrauding the Punjab National Bank (PNB) in Hyderabad of up to ₹42 crore. CBI had claimed that the accused provided wrong information to PNB.

48.title: Bezos loses $10 bn in a day, Musk's wealth declines by $8.4 bn amid market selloff
48.article_body: Amid a US stock market selloff, the wealth of America's richest billionaires declined by $93 billion on Tuesday. While the world's richest person Elon Musk's net worth dropped by $8.4 billion, Jeff Bezos' wealth's plummeted by $9.8 billion and the fortunes of Mark Zuckerberg, Larry Page, Sergey Brin and Steve Ballmer all declined by over $4 billion.

49.title: BJP's 'Operation Kichad' fast-tracked in Goa: Jairam as 8 Cong MLAs join BJP
49.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said that "Operation Kichad" of the BJP in Goa has been fast-tracked because of the visible success of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. His statement came as eight Goa Congress MLAs joined BJP. "BJP is nervous. A daily dose of diversion and disinformation is handed out to undermine the yatra," Ramesh tweeted. "We remain undeterred," he added.

50.title: Pune among 7 cities picked for Urban Flood Risk Management project
50.article_body: The Union government has selected Pune along with 6 other cities for its project on Urban Flood Risk Management. According to Additional Municipal Commissioner Ravindra Binawade, the Union government has sanctioned ₹50 crore to implement the programme in Pune. The funds will be allocated for five years till 2025-2026, the central government informed Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) last week.

51.title: UK inflation falls to 9.9% in August as fuel prices decline
51.article_body: UK consumer price inflation fell to 9.9% in August, official figures showed. This was driven by lower fuel prices which dropped by 6.8% in August, registering their largest monthly fall since April 2020. CPI had reached a 40-year high of 10.1% in July, the ONS said. CPI rose by 0.5% from July to August on a non-seasonally adjusted basis.

52.title: Ryan Reynolds undergoes 'potentially life-saving' surgery, records it on camera
52.article_body: Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds had an "extremely subtle polyp" removed in a "potentially life-saving" colonoscopy. The actor underwent the procedure with his friend Rob McElhenney on camera in a new YouTube video to raise awareness on colon cancer. "This was potentially life-saving for you, I'm not kidding, I'm not being overly dramatic," the doctor told Ryan.

53.title: What happened in 1984 was not riots, it was genocide: Diljit Dosanjh
53.article_body: Speaking about the 1984 Sikh riots, actor Diljit Dosanjh said it should be called genocide and not riots. "When there is a two-sided fight between people, then it's a riot. According to me, it should be called genocide," he added. The riots that began after the assassination of former PM Indira Gandhi resulted in the deaths of over 3,000 Sikhs.

54.title: Pakistan's middle order needs to be changed for T20 World Cup: Inzamam
54.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq has said that the middle-order batting is the biggest concern for the Babar Azam-led side in the T20 World Cup. "The middle order needs to be changed. Australia will be a different ball game," stated Inzamam. "I think Shan Masood and Sharjeel (Khan) and Shoaib Malik should be in the team," he added.

55.title: Man’s nose, ear chopped off for getting daughter remarried in Rajasthan
55.article_body: The nose and ear of a 55-year-old man were chopped off by over a dozen people at a village in Rajasthan's Barmer on Tuesday night for getting his daughter remarried after separation from her husband. According to police, the attackers are believed to be her ex-husband's relatives. They took away his nose and ear with them, his family said.

56.title: Noida man kills wife by hitting her with 'tawa' over delay in dinner
56.article_body: A Noida-based man allegedly murdered his wife after she delayed serving dinner to him. The accused Anuj Kumar, an autorickshaw driver by profession, hit his wife in the head with 'tawa' (pan) leading to her death, the police said. Police informed that the incident took place at Shramik Kunj at Mamura in Sector 66.

57.title: Goodyear settles labour abuse claims with Malaysian factory workers: Report
57.article_body: Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company has reached an agreement to settle a labour dispute at its Malaysian factory with migrant workers who alleged unpaid wages and benefits, Reuters reported. Factory workers reportedly said the settlement agreements signed this year ranged from about $11,000 to $44,200 per worker. The total settlement amount exceeded the original claim of around five million ringgit.

58.title: Asked SRK many questions everyday during 'Brahmastra' shoot: Mouni
58.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy recalled working with actor Shah Rukh Khan in 'Brahmastra' and said that she was "completely amazed" by him. "I used to have so many questions every single day and I would just go and ask him. He was so kind to answer everything," she added. She further called Shah Rukh a charming, intelligent and spontaneous human being.

59.title: Champion: Hardik Pandya on Karthik's 'dreams do come true' tweet
59.article_body: Replying to Dinesh Karthik's viral tweet, "Dreams do come true," all-rounder Hardik Pandya wrote, "Champion". Karthik had shared the tweet after being named in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad on Monday. The last time Karthik was included in India's T20 World Cup squad was for the 2010 edition. The 2022 T20 World Cup will be played in October-November.

60.title: Congress has surrendered, only AAP can compete with BJP: Minister
60.article_body: After eight Congress MLAs joined the BJP in Goa, Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema said that the Congress has surrendered before the BJP. "Only AAP can compete with [the BJP] as we have been able to make their Operation Lotus fail in Punjab," he added. He accused the BJP of trying to "purchase" AAP MLAs for ₹25 crore each.

61.title: PCMC Additional Municipal Commissioner Vikas Dhakane transferred
61.article_body: Maharashtra government has transferred Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation's (PCMC) Additional Municipal Commissioner Vikas Dhakane. However, the state government has not yet announced the posting of Dhakane to any other city or district. PCMC Deputy Municipal Commissioner Smita Zagade will replace him. Meanwhile, Assistant Municipal Commissioner Balasaheb Khandekar has also been transferred.

62.title: 2 loan recovery agents attacked in Hyderabad's Hussaini Alam
62.article_body: Two loan recovery agents of a bank were allegedly attacked in Hyderabad's Hussaini Alam when they went to the house of a defaulter on Tuesday. Bharat Kumar Ragula and Koppula Raju went to the house of credit card payment defaulter near Charminar bus stand. The defaulter allegedly pushed the agents after which they were attacked by 30-35 people with lathis.

63.title: Half of Delhi's population will face impacts of high temp: UN agency
63.article_body: A report by the World Meteorological Organisation (WMO) notes that high-temperature heatwaves occurring frequently in Delhi are putting half of the national capital's population in vulnerable positions. Delhi witnessed five heatwaves with temperatures reaching up to 49.2°C between March and May. "This heatwave led to devastating socioeconomic and public health impacts," the report added.

64.title: Markets end in red with Sensex falling 224 points, Nifty at 18,000
64.article_body: The benchmark indices closed in the red on Wednesday with the Sensex falling 224 points to 60,346. The Nifty declined by 66 points to close at 18,003. IT stocks such as TCS, Infosys, HCL Tech and Tech Mahindra were among the biggest losers. Stocks of IndusInd Bank, SBI and Kotak Mahindra Bank ended as the top Nifty gainers.

65.title: ED conducts searches at some Paytm, PayU offices: Report
65.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Wednesday conducted raids at certain premises of Paytm and PayU in connection with transactions to Chinese shell companies, as per a report. The premises were located in Mumbai, Delhi, Gurgaon, Kolkata and Lucknow. Recently, the ED conducted raids at the Bengaluru premises of Razorpay﻿, Paytm and Cashfree Payments﻿ in a Chinese loan apps case.

66.title: Millionaire City, Expression film studios in Mumbai demolished
66.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has started demolishing illegally constructed studios in Mumbai's Malad region. Millionaire City Studio and Expression Studio in Erangal village have been razed down by the civic body on Wednesday for violating Coastal Regulation Zone (CRZ) mandates. The BMC has recently ordered a probe into the legality of 49 film studios in Mumbai.

67.title: Delhi HC orders Subramanian Swamy to vacate govt bungalow in 6 weeks
67.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Wednesday ordered former Rajya Sabha MP Subramanian Swamy to vacate the government bungalow that was allotted to him in 2016. The court gave him six weeks to do so. Swamy sought to continue his accommodation citing security concerns but the court noted that the house was allotted for five years, a tenure that has ended.

68.title: 8 Cong MLAs joined BJP unconditionally: Goa CM Pramod Sawant
68.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said eight MLAs of the Congress party have joined the BJP unconditionally. "I welcome the eight MLAs who have joined BJP today. Congress started the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', but I think 'Congress chhodo yatra' started in Goa," Sawant added. "People from across the country are leaving Congress and joining BJP," he stated.

69.title: Panvel civic body launches leprosy, tuberculosis awareness campaign
69.article_body: The Panvel Municipal Corporation (PMC) launched a fortnight-long door-to-door leprosy and tuberculosis campaign on Tuesday. PMC chief Ganesh Deshmukh appealed to citizens to report if they show symptoms of these diseases. There's a plan to raise public awareness about leprosy and tuberculosis in tribal areas, societies and slum areas, Assistant Director of Public Health Dr RH Baviskar said.

70.title: Deployed 16 teams to prevent littering, illegal hawking at Kartavya Path: NDMC
70.article_body: New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) has divided the Kartavya Path into eight zones and deployed 16 teams to prevent littering, spitting and illegal hawking in the area. The 32 civic officials from the teams will work across two shifts and fine the violators between ₹50 and ₹2000 based on their offence. The teams reportedly slapped 95 fines till Wednesday.

71.title: 3 killed, 1 injured after car collides with truck in UP's Unnao
71.article_body: Three people died and one was injured after the car they were travelling in collided with a truck in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao late on Tuesday night. The injured were taken to a hospital in Kanpur where three of them succumbed to their injuries, an official said. According to police, the truck driver and conductor had allegedly fled from the spot.

72.title: I felt 'Am I slipping in my game?': Varun on not being in Johar's films
72.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan, during his appearance on the show 'Koffee With Karan 7', revealed that not being cast in Karan Johar's recent films made him doubt his abilities as an actor. "It definitely made me think, 'Am I slipping in my game?'," he said. Varun recently starred in 'JugJugg Jeeyo', which was produced by Johar's Dharma Productions.

73.title: Delhi CM announces online, offline methods to opt for power subsidy
73.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said that online and offline methods will be made available to consumers to opt for power subsidy from Wednesday. In the offline mode, people will receive a form with their next electricity bill, while in the online method, people can give a missed call on 7011311111 and get the form to apply for subsidised electricity.

74.title: India to be represented by President Droupadi Murmu at Queen Elizabeth II's funeral
74.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu will be visiting London on September 17-19 to attend the State Funeral of Queen Elizabeth II and offer condolences on behalf of the Government of India, said the Ministry of External Affairs. External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar had visited the British High Commission in New Delhi on September 12 to convey India's condolences.

75.title: Courts not equipped to determine hijab's essentiality: Petitioners to SC
75.article_body: Petitioners in the hijab ban case told the Supreme Court that wearing hijab is 'farz' (duty) and courts weren't equipped to determine its essentiality. Till practice of wearing hijab is bona fide and prevalent, it must be allowed, the petitioners said. If a belief of a community is proved, then a judge is bound to accept it, they added.

76.title: 145 passengers evacuated after smoke emerges from Air India Express flight in Muscat
76.article_body: Passengers were safely evacuated from an Air India Express flight bound for Kochi on emergency slides after smoke started coming out of the plane at Muscat International Airport on Wednesday. Around 145 passengers onboard were shifted to the terminal building. "Relief flight will be arranged. We will investigate the incident and also take appropriate action," said DGCA.

77.title: BMC to give mall-like design to vegetable and fish markets in Mumbai
77.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will redesign its vegetable and fish markets to upgrade them to mall-like facilities. The civic authorities have directed its architect to redesign the two upcoming markets in Borivali and Nawalkar Market in Jogeshwari in the first phase. The facelifted markets will have specific areas for different products, the civic authorities said.

78.title: Suryakumar can be a great finisher for India in T20 World Cup 2022: Vengsarkar
78.article_body: Ex-Team India chief selector Dilip Vengsarkar said Suryakumar Yadav could be a great finisher for India in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "I feel Suryakumar, who is batting at number four, can bat at five as well...you [don't] need certain batters at certain positions [in T20s]," he stated. Vengsarkar also suggested that Mohammad Shami should've been part of the squad.

79.title: Morale of criminals increasing under Nitish govt in Bihar: BJP leader
79.article_body: After two bike-borne miscreants shot at nine people, killing one in Bihar's Begusarai, BJP national spokesperson Shahnawaz Hussain criticised CM Nitish Kumar's government for the law and order situation in the state. "I was trying to set up industries in Begusarai but now bullets are being fired," Hussain said, adding, "The morale of criminals is increasing in Bihar."

80.title: Ukraine claims downing Iran drone used by Russia; shares pic
80.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry claimed on Tuesday for the first time that its forces had shot down an Iranian-made Shahed-136 drone used by Russia in Kharkiv. The ministry also published images of the wreckage of the drone. In July, US intelligence had warned that Iran was planning to send hundreds of bomb-carrying drones to Russia to aid its war on Ukraine.

81.title: All limits of brutality crossed in WB: RS Prasad on Nabanna march
81.article_body: BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad criticised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee following the party's Nabanna march, saying "all limits of brutality and political violence" were crossed in West Bengal on Tuesday. "CM Mamata Banerjee must answer our questions. She talks about protecting democracy outside Bengal but inside...she crosses all limits in attacking democratic rights," he stated.

82.title: Law & order deteriorates when coalition govt is made: Giriraj on Begusarai incident
82.article_body: Reacting to the Begusarai shooting incident, Union Minister Giriraj Singh on Wednesday said, "Whenever a 'Mahagathbandhan' government is made, law and order situation deteriorates." Furthermore, he said, "CM has now termed 'jungle raj' to 'janta raj'." One person was killed and 10 others were injured in firing by bike-borne men at multiple locations in Begusarai on Tuesday.

83.title: 599 mobile phones stolen or lost during Ganesh Utsav: Pune Police
83.article_body: According to Pune Police, 599 mobile phones were reported as lost or stolen during the Ganesh festival. Only three of these 599 phones have been recovered so far, police added. Six cases have been investigated and 10 people have been arrested. DCP Priyanka Narnaware said that police have busted two theft rackets from Dagadusheth Halwai Ganpati area.

84.title: MNS worker arrested for raping a woman in Mumbai
84.article_body: An MNS worker, claiming to be a party Vibhag Pramukh, was arrested on Monday in Mumbai for allegedly raping a 43-year-old woman multiple times. "He allegedly took her to a restaurant and told her that he wanted to divorce his wife...He also allegedly took her to a hotel and offered to make her a party Shakha Pramukh," police said.

85.title: CM KCR has caught PM Modi syndrome: Telangana BJP chief
85.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar said CM K Chandrashekar Rao has caught "PM Modi syndrome". "A great PM who works 18 hours...world has accepted his greatness and he is being rebuked by KCR," Kumar added. "BJP is the largest party in the world...Is your party similar to ours?" he asked.

86.title: Harvard-backed startup develops EV battery that charges in 3 minutes & lasts 20 years
86.article_body: A Harvard-backed startup has developed a battery suitable for electric vehicles that is capable of fully charging in three minutes and can last for 20 years. Based on lithium-metal technology, the battery can charge over 10,000 cycles in a lifetime. Adden Energy has received $5.15 million in funding to further advance the technology and commercialise the battery.

87.title: 'Congress chhodo, BJP ko jodo': Former Congress leader Lobo
87.article_body: Michael Lobo, who joined BJP on Wednesday, told other Opposition leaders to leave Congress and join BJP. Speaking to reporters before he and seven other leaders joined BJP, Lobo said that they had joined BJP to "strengthen the hands of PM Narendra Modi and Goa CM Pramod Sawant". Other leaders who joined BJP include Delilah Lobo and Digambar Kamat.

88.title: 2,000 kg adulterated paneer seized as FDA raids 2 factories in Pune
88.article_body: Maharashtra Food and Drug Administration officials seized 2,000 kg of adulterated paneer and skimmed milk powder on Monday after raiding two dairy factories in Pune. Officials said adulterated paneer was being made using oil and milk powder at 'Sadguru Milk & Milk Products' and 'Tip-Top Dairy Products'. The factories have been issued notices to stop the business until further orders.

89.title: About 100 troops killed in clashes between Armenia & Azerbaijan
89.article_body: Fighting on the border between Armenia and Azerbaijan killed about 100 troops on Tuesday. Armenia said 49 of its soldiers died in the clashes, while Azerbaijan claimed it has lost 50 troops. The two countries have blamed each other for the latest outbreak of violence. Armenia and Azerbaijan have been fighting for decades over the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region.

90.title: Motorcycle-borne men shoot at woman outside daughter's home in outer Delhi
90.article_body: A 55-year-old woman was reportedly shot at by two bike-borne men in front of her daughter and granddaughter outside their home in outer Delhi on Monday. According to police, the woman had gone to meet her daughter at her house in Prakash Vihar when the incident happened. She's undergoing treatment at hospital, and her condition is said to be serious.

91.title: People waste their outrage on useless things like Bollywood: Gulshan Devaiah
91.article_body: Gulshan Devaiah said people direct their outrage towards "useless things like Bollywood", while they should channel their anger towards scams in the country. The actor will next feature in 'Shiksha Mandal', which is based on Vyapam scam in Madhya Pradesh and sheds light on educational scams. Gulshan said the show is "relevant" and allowed him "to play a good guy".

92.title: Vedanta project shifted to Gujarat under political pressure: Ajit Pawar
92.article_body: NCP's Ajit Pawar wrote to CM Eknath Shinde asking him to make all efforts to ensure that Vedanta's semiconductor plant in Gujarat be set up in Maharashtra. Everything had been finalised for it to be in Maharashtra but was shifted to Gujarat under political pressure, Pawar wrote. "This will be a blow to the economic development of Maharashtra," he added.

93.title: Cooperating in probe: BSES after Delhi girl crushed under iron gate
93.article_body: A BSES spokesperson on Wednesday expressed condolences after a 13-year-old girl died when an iron gate of a BSES office fell on her in Delhi on Monday afternoon. "Our condolences are with the family of the deceased. We're cooperating with authorities in the investigation," the spokesperson said. The deceased girl was walking back home from school when the incident occurred.

94.title: 8 Goa Congress MLAs join BJP in presence of CM Pramod Sawant
94.article_body: As many as eight Congress MLAs, including former Goa CM Digambar Kamat, joined BJP in presence of CM Pramod Sawant. "I welcome the eight MLAs who have joined BJP today," Sawant said. "Congress started the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', but I think 'Congress Chhodo Yatra' started in Goa," he added. "People from across the country are leaving Congress...joining BJP," Sawant stated.

95.title: Vedanta to create hub to manufacture iPhones in India: Anil Agarwal
95.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal said his company will look at creating a hub to manufacture Apple's iPhones and TV equipment in Maharashtra. This comes a day after Vedanta announced that it'll set up semiconductor and display production plants in Gujarat in collaboration with Apple supplier Foxconn. Maharashtra's plant would be "kind of forward  integration for Gujarat's JV plant", Agarwal said.

96.title: Road rage victim walks into Mumbai hospital with intestines in hand
96.article_body: A 30-year-old man, who was stabbed during a road rage incident in Mumbai's Dombivili, reportedly walked into a hospital with his intestines in hand. According to police, the mini truck of Harshad Rasal brushed the accused, Pandit Mhatre's car, which led to a heated argument between them. Following this, Mhatre stabbed Rasal twice, due to which his intestines came out.

97.title: Arrest warrant issued for Terraform Labs Co-founder Kwon in S Korea
97.article_body: A South Korean court has issued an arrest warrant for Terraform Labs (TFL) Co-founder Do Kwon. The court issued the warrant against five other people on allegations that include violations of the nation's capital markets law. All six individuals are located in Singapore. The warrant comes a few months after the Terra ecosystem and its stablecoin (UST) collapsed.

98.title: From Bollywood to OTT, everybody operating in fear: Kunal Kamra
98.article_body: Comedian Kunal Kamra said everybody from Bollywood to OTT to comedians is "operating in some fear". "The spontaneity that any art form has is totally killed," he said, adding that fear is never good for any art form. Recently, Kamra's shows were cancelled after members of Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) threatened to protest.

99.title: Annu Kapoor, Abhishek Banerjee to star in 'Dream Girl 2': Reports
99.article_body: Annu Kapoor, Abhishek Banerjee and Manjot Singh have reportedly joined Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Dream Girl 2'. The actors, who were also a part of the first Raaj Shaandilyaa directorial, will play pivotal roles in the film, reports said. The team of 'Dream Girl 2' is currently shooting in Mumbai and the makers are expecting to release the film in 2023.

100.title: Karan, Shah Rukh & Akshay have nothing to do with my arrest: KRK
100.article_body: Actor Kamaal R Khan has replied to reports claiming that Karan Johar was behind his arrest. On Wednesday, he tweeted that the claims were "not true" and clarified that Karan, Shah Rukh Khan, Aamir Khan, Ajay Devgn, Akshay Kumar and others have "nothing to do" with his arrest. Khan was arrested over derogatory tweet and molestation cases on August 30.

101.title: Anderson, Broad will be part of England squad for Ashes: Brendon McCullum
101.article_body: England Test head coach Brendon McCullum has said pacers James Anderson and Stuart Broad will be part of their squad for the Ashes next year. "Stuff you don't see behind the scenes. The time, the effort and the confidence they're giving the other guys is quite remarkable, really," he added. Anderson and Broad are England's leading wicket-takers in Test cricket.

102.title: Over 40 tea garden workers injured after van overturns in West Bengal
102.article_body: Over 40 tea garden workers were injured after their vehicle overturned in West Bengal's Siliguri on Wednesday. The incident happened when the pick-up van carrying the workers was heading to Gulma tea garden, police said. All injured are being treated at a health centre while those critically injured have been admitted to the North Bengal Medical College and Hospital.

103.title: Virat Kohli jumps 14 spots in latest T20I rankings
103.article_body: After slamming his maiden hundred in T20I cricket, Virat Kohli has jumped 14 spots in the latest rankings for T20I batters. Kohli, who was ranked 29th last week, is now ranked 15th with 599 rating points. Rohit Sharma (14th) and Suryakumar Yadav (fourth) are the other two Indian batters in the top 15.

104.title: Rajasthan's 'snake man' dies minutes after being bitten by cobra, video surfaces
104.article_body: Vinod Tiwari, a man hailing from Rajasthan's Churu district and popularly known as 'snake man', passed away after being bitten by a venomous cobra. A CCTV footage showing Tiwari catching the cobra outside a shop moments before his death has surfaced online. The snake reportedly bit his finger when he tried to put it in a bag.

105.title: Tile vendor sets Noida man's Mercedes on fire over non-payment of dues, video surfaces
105.article_body: Noida Police have arrested a man for allegedly setting a Mercedes car on fire. Police said the accused was identified as Ranveer, a mason and tile vendor, who was hired by the owner of the Mercedes to put tiles in his house a few days ago. "There was a dispute regarding the non-payment of dues for the work," police said.

106.title: Will penalise those who've tinted glass on vehicles: Delhi Police
106.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police took to Twitter and said that they will penalise those who have tinted glass or glass films beyond permissible limits on their vehicles, starting from Wednesday. "Also, we will keep a check on minors indulging in driving without a license and penalise the vehicle owners," it said. Delhi Traffic Police shared the post with the hashtag #IssFilmParAwardNahi.

107.title: 6 arrested after mob beats up 4 sadhus in Maharashtra's Sangli
107.article_body: Six people have been arrested for allegedly assaulting four sadhus in Maharashtra's Sangli on Wednesday. The sadhus were beaten up by a mob on suspicion of being child thieves. The incident occurred when the sadhus asked a boy for directions, following which the locals became suspicious. A video of the incident has surfaced.

108.title: Cheetahs to travel on empty stomach from Namibia to India: Official
108.article_body: Cheetahs arriving from Namibia as part of the cheetah reintroduction in India will be travelling on empty stomach, said Madhya Pradesh's Principal Chief Conservator of Forests (Wildlife) JS Chauhan. Such a precaution is required as long journey may create nausea-like feelings leading to other complications, Chauhan added. The cheetahs will be introduced in MP's Kuno National Park on September 17.

109.title: Mysterious underground sounds reported at village in Maharashtra
109.article_body: Mysterious underground sounds have been reported at Hasori village in Maharashtra's Latur district, an official said on Tuesday. District officials have requested experts from the Indian Institute of Geomagnetism to visit the village to study the phenomenon, he said. Latur district collector Prithviraj B P visited the village on Tuesday and told people not to panic.

110.title: I have a small reservation about Harshal being part of T20 WC squad: Aakash
110.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said that he has a "small reservation" about pacer Harshal Patel being part of India's squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. "The sample size of match-winning performances [by Harshal] is not there in international cricket," stated Aakash. "You have just one gun death bowler, [and] that's Jasprit Bumrah," he added.

111.title: BJP approached 10 AAP MLAs in Punjab: Arvind Kejriwal
111.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday claimed that BJP has approached 10 AAP MLAs in Punjab. "They are buying MLAs and breaking governments," Kejriwal added. AAP MLAs have been asked to come to Delhi to meet big leaders and have been offered crores to switch sides, Punjab minister Harpal Cheema claimed.

112.title: 7 labourers die as under-construction building lift collapses in Ahmedabad
112.article_body: As many as seven labourers were killed and one was critically injured after a lift at an under-construction building collapsed in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. The incident took place on Wednesday around 10 am, and the fire and police team reached the spot around 1 pm. "We learnt from media reports...that such an incident had occurred," a fire official claimed.

113.title: AAP is 'BJP's B team', trying to mislead voters of Himachal: Cong
113.article_body: Congress spokesperson Alka Lamba said AAP is "BJP's B team" and is trying to mislead the voters of Himachal Pradesh by making false promises in the name of pre-poll guarantees. The Congress was in direct contest with BJP in Uttarakhand and Goa polls but AAP contested elections in both the states to "ensure" BJP's victory, she stated.

114.title: S Korea fines Google, Meta $72 mn for privacy violations, Meta to fight decision
114.article_body: South Korea has fined Google and Meta $72 million for privacy law violations. While Google has been fined $50 million by the Personal Information Protection Commission, Meta is facing a fine of $22 million. "We do not agree with the commission's decision, and will be open to all options including seeking a ruling from the court," Meta said.

115.title: India's WPI inflation falls to 11-month low of 12.41% in August
115.article_body: India's Wholesale Price Index (WPI) inflation fell to an 11-month low of 12.41% in August, the Commerce Ministry said on Wednesday. This was driven by a decline in fuel prices. Overall, the all-commodity index of the WPI was down 0.5% in August compared to July. The WPI inflation was 13.93% in July, while it stood at 11.64% in August 2021.

116.title: ThoughtSpot﻿ to invest $150 million in India over next 5 years
116.article_body: Cloud analytics company ﻿ThoughtSpot﻿ announced an investment of $150 million across its operations in India over the next five years. It also announced the opening of a new office in Thiruvananthapuram, which would be its third R&D centre in the country. The Sudheesh Nair-led company said its annual recurring revenue from cloud offerings grew by 102% in the last year.

117.title: Govt considering 100% WFH across all SEZ units: Piyush Goyal
117.article_body: The Commerce Ministry is looking to allow 100% work from home (WFH) for employees of units in the special economic zones (SEZs), Union Minister Piyush Goyal said. He further said that WFH can help in creating job opportunities in smaller cities such as Rajkot and Una, adding, "It is in the interest of the country to allow work from home."

118.title: Which cities have the most millionaires in the world?
118.article_body: New York with 3.5 lakh millionaires, Tokyo with 3 lakh millionaires, and the San Francisco Bay Area with 2.76 lakh millionaires are the wealthiest places in the world, according to a report by Henley & Partners Group. These places are followed by London and Singapore, Los Angeles, Malibu, Chicago and Houston in the US and Beijing and Shanghai in China.

119.title: Wipro, Prestige among firms on BBMP's list for encroaching on stormwater drains
119.article_body:
With rains flooding the city for days, the BBMP has collated a list of IT Parks and developers encroaching on stormwater drains. The list has names of buildings of Wipro, Prestige, Eco Space and Columbia Asia hospital among others. "We've asked our officers to demolish any
encroachments whether it's rich or poor," said Karnataka Revenue Minister R Ashoka.

120.title: Twitter can't protect data, it doesn't know what data it has: Whistleblower
120.article_body: Twitter whistleblower Peiter Zatko on Tuesday told the US Senate Judiciary Committee that Twitter leadership is "misleading" public and lawmakers. "They don't know what data they have, where it lives and where it came from and so, unsurprisingly, they can't protect it," Zatko said in his testimony. He added, "It doesn't matter who has keys if there are no locks."

121.title: Pics of Chenab rail bridge in a sea of clouds go viral
121.article_body: The Ministry of Railways took to Twitter to share pictures of the Chenab rail bridge which is part of the Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla rail link project. The images show the arch of the under-construction Chenab rail bridge towering over a sea of clouds. The steel arch of the bridge, which is the world's highest railway bridge, was completed in April 2021.

122.title: JNPA hands over 814 hectares of mangroves to forest dept in Mumbai
122.article_body: The Jawaharlal Nehru Port Authority (JNPA) on Tuesday handed over 814 hectares of mangrove land on its property in Mumbai to the state forest department for safekeeping. The step was taken pursuant to Bombay High Court orders in 2004 and 2018, instructing all government agencies to hand over their mangrove lands, which will be protected as legal forests.

123.title: BMW to set up auto parts manufacturing plant in Punjab: CM Bhagwant Mann
123.article_body: German car manufacturer BMW has agreed to set up its auto parts manufacturing plant in Punjab "on a large scale", CM Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday said. The decision was taken during Mann's visit to the BMW headquarters in Germany. Notably, this will be BMW's second auto parts manufacturing unit in India after the one operational in Chennai.

124.title: 7 policemen suspended after gunmen kill 1, injure 10 in Begusarai
124.article_body: Seven policemen have been suspended after two bike-borne gunmen opened fire at 10 locations in Bihar's Begusarai on Tuesday. A 25-year-old man died and 10 other people were left injured in the mass shooting. ADG Jitendra Singh Gangwar said that despite the presence of a patrolling party on the streets, the shooters couldn't be stopped.

125.title: Bihar has become 'gunda raj': BJP leader on Begusarai shooting incident
125.article_body: Bihar's Leader of Opposition Vijay Kumar Sinha criticised Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government over Begusarai shooting incident in which one person was killed and several got injured. "He [Nitish] has termed 'jungle raj' as 'janta raj' but it has gone far beyond that and has become 'gunda raj' and then he wants to take responsibility of the nation," BJP's Sinha said.

126.title: Man kills wife in front of their minor children in Mumbai, arrested
126.article_body: Police have arrested a 44-year-old man for allegedly stabbing his 38-year-old wife to death in the presence of their minor children in Mumbai's Malad (West). The incident reportedly occurred on Monday after an argument broke out between the couple. According to police, the couple had been married for 16 years. They have a 14-year-old son and two daughters, police added.

127.title: Ex-Army jawan dies after police lathicharge during protest in Guj
127.article_body: A 72-year-old retired Army jawan, Kanji Bhai Mothalia, died after allegedly getting hit in a police lathicharge during a protest in Gujarat's Gandhinagar on Tuesday. The jawans were protesting over 14 demands, including jobs for family members of martyrs and reservation in state jobs. One of the protesters said that Mothalia was hit on his chest and died during treatment.

128.title: Harsha Engineers becomes 4th firm to launch IPO within a month
128.article_body: With Ahmedabad-based Harsha Engineers International set to launch its initial public offering (IPO) on Wednesday, this will be the fourth IPO to hit Dalal Street in a little over a month. Prior to Harsha Engineers, Syrma SGS, DreamFolks and Tamilnad Mercantile Bank made their market debut. Harsha Engineers' IPO worth ₹755 crore will close for subscription on Friday.

129.title: Byju’s audited revenue expected to be lower than projected: Report
129.article_body: Edtech firm Byju's Founder and CEO Byju Raveendran has reportedly informed stakeholders that the company's audited revenue and projected revenue could have a difference. He added that this could be because of the change in how the firm recognises its revenue and the actual revenue would be lower than projected. Byju's is yet to submit its FY21 annual report.

130.title: Go First's official Twitter handle hacked, airline says 'matter being investigated'
130.article_body: Go First's official Twitter was hacked on Wednesday, confirmed the airline. It added, "Concerned teams are investigating into the matter to restore and gain control at the earliest." The name on the page was changed to "vitalik.eth" and the display picture was changed to Ethereum Co-founder Vitalik Buterin's. The page also posted various Ethereum giveaways in a series of tweets.

131.title: PM has given 1,000 sq km of territory to China without fight: Rahul
131.article_body: Congress' Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday tweeted, "China has refused to accept India's demand of restoring status quo of April 2020. PM has given 1,000 sq km of territory to China without a fight." Earlier, the two sides in a joint statement said that Indian and Chinese troops began disengagement from Gogra-Hot Springs in Ladakh.

132.title: Declare Noida as part of Delhi: AAP leader writes to PM Modi
132.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) Gautam Buddha Nagar unit chief has urged PM Narendra Modi to make the western Uttar Pradesh district, including Noida, a part of Delhi. "The Arvind Kejriwal government is providing basic civic facilities...to...people of Delhi free of cost...but the entire Gautam Buddha Nagar district, including Noida, is deprived of it," Bhupendra Singh Jadaun wrote in a letter.

133.title: Telugu actress raped by Mumbai fitness trainer who promised to marry her
133.article_body: A fitness trainer has been arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly raping an actress under the pretext of marrying her. The accused had met the 24-year-old actress, who has worked in Telugu movies, at the residence of a common friend in Bandra. The actress said he raped her at his residence in Cuffe Parade and also in Goa.

134.title: 6 Pakistani nationals held with 40 kg heroin worth ₹200 crore off Gujarat coast
134.article_body: The Gujarat Anti Terrorist Squad on Wednesday, in a joint operation with the Indian Coast Guard, seized 40 kg heroin worth ₹200 crore from a Pakistani fishing boat in the Arabian Sea off the Gujarat coast. Six Pakistani crew members of the boat were also apprehended. The fishing boat carrying drugs was intercepted mid-sea near Kutch's Jakhau harbour.

135.title: At least 17 mn people in Europe experienced long COVID-19: WHO
135.article_body: At least 17 million people across the 53 member states of WHO's European Region experienced post COVID-19 condition also known as long COVID-19, World Health Organization (WHO) said. The WHO estimated that 10% to 20% develop mid- and long-term symptoms such as fatigue, breathlessness and cognitive dysfunction. "Females are twice as likely as males to experience long COVID-19," it added.

136.title: I'm p*ssed off, we didn't deserve to lose to Bayern Munich: Barca manager Xavi
136.article_body: Barcelona manager Xavi said that his side did not deserve to lose 0-2 to Bayern Munich in their Champions League Group C match on Tuesday night. "I'm p*ssed off...I think we were better, we dominated them. We were better," said Xavi after the match. Bayern have now defeated Barcelona in five straight games in recent years.

137.title: House of Bhopal school bus driver accused of raping 3-year-old student demolished
137.article_body: Authorities in Bhopal's Shahpura area in Madhya Pradesh demolished the house of a school bus driver who was arrested for allegedly raping a three-year-old nursery student inside the vehicle. The authorities claimed that the construction was illegal. Notably, police also arrested a woman attendant who, according to the child's parents, was present inside the vehicle when the incident took place.

138.title: SBI stock touches record high, becomes 3rd Indian lender to cross ₹5 trillion m-cap
138.article_body: SBI shares touched a record high of ₹566 during intraday trading on Wednesday. With this, SBI has become the third lender and the eighth Indian company in the country to cross the market cap of ₹5 trillion. HDFC Bank holds the first rank in this list with a market cap of ₹8.38 trillion, followed by ICICI Bank (₹6.33 trillion).

139.title: They don't have anything else to do: Mouni on 'Boycott Brahmastra' trend
139.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy said that while the boycott trend against 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' didn't bother her, she wondered why somebody would write such things without watching the film first. She called the trolls "phantom people" who hide behind their screens and "don't have anything else to do". The actress played Junoon in the Ayan Mukerji directorial.

140.title: Madras HC directs man to distribute pamphlets against drunk-driving
140.article_body: Madras High Court has directed a man, who drove a four-wheeler in an inebriated state and injured three pedestrians, to distribute pamphlets against drunk driving at a busy city junction for two weeks from 9-10 am and from 5-7 pm. The court granted him conditional bail. The man was arrested earlier and remanded in judicial custody on August 23.

141.title: Delhi shoe store owner stabbed to death over money in e-wallet
141.article_body: A 58-year-old shoe store owner was allegedly stabbed to death by two men in Delhi's Batla House area on Tuesday. According to police, the accused killed him after they reportedly saw ₹40,000 in his Paytm wallet and decided to steal it. The accused, identified as Mehraj Alam and Taufiq, were later arrested by the police for robbery and murder.

142.title: Jacqueline arrives for questioning by Delhi Police in ₹200-crore money laundering case
142.article_body: Jacqueline Fernandez arrived at the office of the Economic Offences Wing of the Delhi Police on Wednesday in connection with the ₹200 crore extortion case involving conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar. Pinky Irani who allegedly introduced Jacqueline and Sukesh also arrived for questioning today. A list of questions has been prepared for Jacqueline and she is likely to be confronted with Pinky.

143.title: Bengaluru companies seek municipal zone over 17 km ORR stretch
143.article_body: The Outer Ring Road Companies Association in Bengaluru submitted a proposal to IT Minister CN Ashwathnarayan demanding the 17km Outer Ring Road (ORR) stretch from Central Silk Board to Lowry Junction be made a separate municipal zone. The association said that the new municipal zone should have a clear 5-year plan to transform the corridor into a world-class technology corridor.

144.title: Muslims forced to believe every policy is to destroy their existence: Muslim body
144.article_body: Following UP government's move to conduct a survey of madrassas, Jamiat Ulama-e-Hind's President Maulana Arshad Madani said his objection is to the "sectarian" mentality in the current situation. "The way sectarian forces have created an atmosphere of hatred…Muslims are forced to believe that every policy is coming forward to destroy their existence," Madani added.

145.title: Army jawan kills witness in rape case against brother in Nagpur
145.article_body: A 30-year-old Army jawan, Bharat Ramachandra Kamble, allegedly shot dead a 52-year-old man, who was a witness in a rape case against his brother in Nagpur. Kamble's brother was arrested for allegedly raping a minor girl in 2021. The jawan, who was visiting his village on leave, tried to escape but was arrested by police.

146.title: Indian citizen pleads guilty in 1st-ever crypto insider trading case in US
146.article_body:
A former Coinbase employee's brother pleaded guilty in the first-ever cryptocurrency insider trading case in the US. The former employee shared confidential Coinbase information with his 
26-year-old Indian brother and his Indian-American friend, who then used Ethereum blockchain wallets to acquire the assets and traded at least 14 times before Coinbase announcements in June 2021 and April 2022.

147.title: Dev is fulcrum of the entire trilogy: Ayan on 'Brahmastra' sequel
147.article_body: Director Ayan Mukerji said the sequel of 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' will "be continuing the present story, but also telling you the story of the past". The sequel's story will revolve around the antagonist, Dev, who Ayan called the "fulcrum of the entire 'Brahmastra' trilogy". Ayan said he will announce the casting for the part when the time is right.

148.title: He's the perfect choice: 'Taarak Mehta...' producer on casting Sachin Shroff
148.article_body: 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' producer Asit Kumarr Modi said Sachin Shroff was the "perfect choice" to replace Shailesh Lodha in the television series. The producer said the makers "wanted a face that is known and connects well with the audience". He added, "We wanted a committed actor and he's the perfect choice for us in [those] terms also."

149.title: 'Avatar' puts us back into childlike wonder about nature: Cameron
149.article_body: Director James Cameron said as human lives progressed, they drifted apart from nature, and his film 'Avatar' gave them an experience that they could relate to. "This movie puts us back into that childlike wonder about nature, about nature's grandeur, complexity and beauty," he said. He said the audience saw "some universality of their lives" in the 'Avatar' characters.

150.title: Chahal only legit wicket-taking option among spinners for T20 WC: Aakash
150.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said Yuzvendra Chahal is the only legit wicket-taking option among the spinners selected for the T20 World Cup in Australia. "The others are defensive options...that is the truth. You can see the numbers for the last 12 months, IPL included for both of them, Axar Patel and Ravichandran Ashwin," he added.

151.title: Paris to turn off Eiffel Tower lights early to save electricity
151.article_body: Lights on the Eiffel Tower will be turned off at 11:45 pm instead of 1 am starting from September 23 to save energy amid Europe's energy crisis, Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo said. Extinguishing the monument's lights early would mean a 4% reduction in its power consumption. Lights at other landmark monuments in Paris will be switched off at 10 pm.

152.title: That sorry was for my fans: Urvashi Rautela on video showing her saying sorry to Pant
152.article_body: After a video shared by 'Instant Bollywood' showed actress Urvashi Rautela saying "I am sorry" to cricketer Rishabh Pant, she said, "That sorry was for my fans and loved ones." "These days official news articles and so called meme pages (worst marketers) are more scripted than movies or a TV show," she added.

153.title: Medical student helps pregnant woman deliver baby on Duronto Express
153.article_body: A 28-year-old pregnant woman went into labour while travelling on Secunderabad-Visakhapatnam Duronto Express on Tuesday. A final year student of Visakhapatnam's GITAM medical college, K Swathi Reddy, who was also on board the train, helped the woman deliver the baby. Reddy said she was worried as it was the first delivery that she performed on her own.

154.title: Neetu Kapoor, Soni Razdan to host baby shower for Alia Bhatt: Reports
154.article_body: Neetu Kapoor and Soni Razdan will reportedly host a baby shower for Alia Bhatt by the end of this month. As per reports, the event will host Alia's childhood friends along with Kareena Kapoor Khan, Karisma Kapoor, Navya Nanda, Shweta Bachchan and Aarti Shetty, among others. Alia, who got married to Ranbir Kapoor in April, announced her pregnancy in June.

155.title: Pakistan asks Taliban to trace, arrest Jaish chief amid pressure from West: Report
155.article_body: Pakistan has contacted the Taliban in Afghanistan to trace and arrest Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) chief Masood Azhar, according to a Pakistani media report. The move comes amid pressure on Pakistan from Western powers to act against Masood Azhar, a UN-designated terrorist. Pakistan's letter said that he is "mostly likely hiding" in Nangarhar province or Kunar province of Afghanistan.

156.title: Was not ready because there was a gap: Ayesha Jhulka on OTT debut
156.article_body: Ayesha Jhulka, who is making her OTT debut with 'Hush Hush', said she wasn't sure about starring in the series. The actress said when she was offered the show, she thought she "wasn't really ready" to make an acting comeback after a long break. 'Hush Hush', directed by Tanuja Chandra, also stars Kritika Kamra, Soha Ali Khan and Karishma Tanna.

157.title: Over 1,500 electricity theft incidents reported in G'gram in last 12 months
157.article_body: The Dakshin Haryana Bijli Vitran Nigam (DHBVN) said that over 1,500 incidents of electricity theft were reported in Gurugram in last 12 months. Managing Director of DHBVN said that in Gurugram 1 and 2 circles, the power utility carried out 3,362 checks and found 1,559 incidents of thefts, which led to cumulative imposition of fines of ₹13.59 crore on violators.

158.title: EWS quota a fraud on Constitution: Petitioners' counsel to Supreme Court
158.article_body: Commenting on the Constitution (103rd Amendment) Act, which introduced a 10% quota for Economically Weaker Sections (EWS) in government jobs and admissions, the petitioners' counsel told the Supreme Court that it's "a fraud on Constitution". It was dividing the country along caste lines, the counsel added. Reservation cannot be implemented as a "poverty alleviation programme", the counsel stated.

159.title: Rupee falls to 79.60 against US dollar amid crude oil price rise
159.article_body: The rupee declined by 45 paise to 79.60 against the US dollar on Wednesday from Tuesday's close of 79.15 amid a surge in global crude oil prices. The dollar index was last down 0.1% at 109.45. After the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries kept oil demand forecasts unchanged from last month, the prices of global crude oil rose.

160.title: 8 Congress MLAs, including ex-CM Digambar Kamat, to join BJP: Goa BJP chief
160.article_body: As many as eight Congress MLAs, including former Goa CM Digambar Kamat, are set to join BJP on Wednesday, the state party chief Sadanand Shet Tanavade said. The others include former Leader of Opposition Michael Lobo, Delilah Lobo, Rajesh Phaldesai, Kedar Naik, Sankalp Amonkar, Aleixo Sequeira and Rudolf Fernandes. Congress currently has 11 MLAs in the Goa Assembly.

161.title: 11 killed, 25 injured as bus falls into gorge in Jammu and Kashmir
161.article_body: At least 11 people were killed and 25 were injured after a bus they were travelling in met with an accident in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch, ANI reported. The bus reportedly skidded off the road and plunged into a deep gorge. Lieutenant Governor of Jammu and Kashmir Manoj Sinha announced ₹5 lakh each for the family members of the deceased.

162.title: 4 sadhus beaten up on suspicion of being child-lifters in Maha's Sangli; video surfaces
162.article_body: A mob allegedly beat up four 'sadhus' with sticks at Lavanga village in Maharashtra's Sangli on suspicion of being child-lifters, police said. A video of the incident surfaced online and went viral. The incident occurred when the four 'sadhus', who hail from Uttar Pradesh, were heading towards the temple town of Pandharpur from Bijapur in Karnataka in a car.

163.title: Vinesh loses in qualification round at Wrestling C'ships, to play for bronze
163.article_body: Commonwealth Games 2022 gold medallist Vinesh Phogat lost to Mongolia's Khulan Batkhuyag 0-7 in the qualification round of the women's freestyle 53kg category at the World Wrestling Championships. Notably, Vinesh still has a chance to win a medal through the Repechage round. She'll have to defeat Kazakhstan's Zhuldyz Eshimova and then Azerbaijan's Leyla Gurbanova to enter the bronze medal match.

164.title: Raj Thackeray demands probe as Vedanta project goes to Gujarat from Maha
164.article_body: Raj Thackeray demanded a probe into how Vedanta-Foxconn deal went to Gujarat instead of Maharashtra and said that the deal reaching Gujarat is serious and not a good sign. "We should go beyond politics and look at this issue," Thackeray added. This comes after Vedanta announced that it will set up its semiconductor plant worth ₹1.54 lakh crore in Gujarat.

165.title: I'd have picked Shami, Umran and Shubman for 2022 T20 WC: Vengsarkar
165.article_body: Ex-Team India chief selector Dilip Vengsarkar has said he would have picked Mohammad Shami, Umran Malik and Shubman Gill for the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. "The express pace of Shami is missing. If you see Harshal Patel, Arshdeep Singh and Bhuvneshwar Kumar, they're not express. The only bowler who has got that pace is Jasprit Bumrah," added Vengsarkar.

166.title: Gambia suspends paracetamol syrup sales amid child deaths
166.article_body: The Gambia has ordered importers and shops to suspend sales of all brands of paracetamol syrup. This comes as the government investigates a suspected link between the syrup and the deaths of dozens of young children in the country from kidney failure. A spike in cases of acute kidney injury among children aged below five was detected in late July.

167.title: What is a 'ghost mall' and how many 'ghost malls' are there in India?
167.article_body: According to international property consultant Knight Frank, if a mall has a vacancy of more than 40%, it's considered as a 'ghost mall'. As per its report 'Think India, Think Retail 2022', 57 of the 271 operational malls in top eight cities - Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chennai, Hyderabad, Kolkata, Mumbai, National Capital Region (NCR) and Pune are in a dilapidated state.

168.title: 35-yr-old woman cyclist molested near Noida Sector-52
168.article_body: A 35-year-old woman cyclist was allegedly molested by an unidentified commuter on a two-wheeler near Sector-52 in Noida on Tuesday. The incident reportedly took place around 5 am when the woman was on her regular cycling route along with six other women. When she raised her voice, the suspect pushed her and fled, leaving her injured, reports said.

169.title: Gandhi family famous for dividing India: BJP's Rajyavardhan Rathore
169.article_body: BJP leader Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore said that Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is 'Bharat todo yatra' as Rahul Gandhi is meeting with anti-India people during his journey. "The Gandhi family is famous for dividing India, be it Jawaharlal Nehru…Indira Gandhi," Rathore added. "They only do vote bank politics and their Islamic thinking is breaking the country," Rathore stated.

170.title: Engineering student cheated by man posing as policeman in Pune
170.article_body: A 20-year-old engineering student was allegedly cheated of ₹20,000 by a man impersonating a police officer in Pune. According to the victim, Gaurav Bhoi, the accused threatened him saying he had received a complaint against him for inviting girls to his room. He then demanded money from Bhoi to avoid a police complaint against him.

171.title: 9-month-old undergoes rare incompatible liver transplant in Mumbai
171.article_body: A nine-month-old boy successfully underwent an incompatible liver transplant, a rare surgery at Mumbai's Nanavati Hospital last month. The baby, named Vayu Visavadia, received the organ from his aunt who has a different blood group from him. His blood, therefore, had to be desensitised to ensure that his body does not reject the transplanted organ.

172.title: Up to 100 King Charles' staff could lose jobs as he moves to Buckingham Palace: Report
172.article_body: Up to 100 employees at King Charles' Clarence House have reportedly been given notice of their redundancy as he and Queen Consort move to Buckingham Palace after Queen Elizabeth's death. As per a report, some of these employees have worked there for decades. Some staff allegedly assumed they would receive new roles in King's new household.

173.title: 6 people cheat Pune bank to obtain ₹23 lakh gold loan, booked
173.article_body: Police have booked six people, including a gold valuer, for allegedly cheating a Pune bank of ₹22.78 lakh by submitting fake gold as collateral for five gold loans. The loans were reportedly sanctioned between November 2020 and November 2021. According to the FIR, the incident came to light in January this year after the bank manager did an internal audit.

174.title: Azimganj Serai to emerge as one of Delhi's major tourist spots: Sisodia
174.article_body: Delhi's Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that Nizamuddin's Azimganj Serai will emerge as a major tourist spot after the completion of restoration work. "Buildings of historical importance such as Azimganj Serai have remained neglected for a long time, due to which they have suffered a lot. But Kejriwal government is ensuring that each of them is preserved," he added.
