At a meeting held to review the implementation of central schemes in the state, Khattar urged officials to make adequate arrangements to provide houses to all needy people. The CM also directed officers to expedite construction work of houses.

351.title: Survey of unaided madrasas is a targeted survey & is wrong: Owaisi
351.article_body: After the UP government announced its decision to conduct a survey of unrecognised madrasas in the state, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "It is a targeted survey against the Muslim community." "Doing survey of unaided madrasas is a targeted survey and is wrong," he said. "Survey of private schools, missionary schools, government schools and RSS schools should happen," he added.

352.title: K'taka man fires at wife for refusing to go with him from her parents' home
352.article_body: A man was arrested in Karnataka's Belagavi for allegedly firing at his wife after she refused to go with him from her parents' home. The woman had left him three months ago over his alleged extra-marital affair. He begged her to return many times and had also threatened to kill her and commit suicide if she didn't return to him.

353.title: Priyanka Gandhi demands rollback of Allahabad university's fee hike
353.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi supported the student protest against Allahabad university's fee hike and called the BJP government’s move anti-youth. “The 400% fee hike is another anti-youth move of the government. Children from ordinary families of UP, Bihar come here to study. By increasing fees, the government will take away a major source of education from these youth,” said Priyanka.

354.title: India not defending Rupee, it can take care of itself: CEA Nageswaran
354.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran said India isn't defending the Rupee and that the currency "can take care of itself". "I don't think Indian fundamentals are such that we need to defend the Rupee," Nageswaran added. "RBI is making sure that whatever direction the Rupee is moving in line with the market trends is just gradual," he said.

355.title: Zendaya hides face as Emmy host jokes she is 'too old' to date DiCaprio, video viral
355.article_body: A video shows actress Zendaya, who recently turned 26, hiding her face as Emmy host Kenan Thompson joked she's "too old" to date Leonardo DiCaprio. "Zendaya just turned 26. 26 is a weird age in Hollywood. Young enough to play...high school student, but too old to date Leonardo DiCaprio," Kenan joked. The crowd can be heard laughing at Kenan's joke.

356.title: I believed that we need such a story: Mrunal Thakur on 'Sita Ramam'
356.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur said she signed for 'Sita Ramam' in 2020 and added that people questioned her decision to sign a Telugu film after featuring in Bollywood films. "People do Telugu films and then come to Bollywood. I believed in the story [of 'Sita Ramam'] and my character. I believed that we need such a story," she further stated.

357.title: 'Arvind Advertisement Party': Cong on AAP over ads in Guj by Punjab govt
357.article_body: Congress on Tuesday accused AAP of getting its Punjab government to spend on advertisements in poll-bound Gujarat, calling it the "Arvind Advertisement Party". Congress alleged that the Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government doesn't have money to pay salaries, but spent ₹36 crore on advertisements. AAP has spent about ₹490 crore on advertisements in 2021-22, said Congress leader Ajoy Kumar.

358.title: Gyanvapi ruling a clear violation of Places of Worship Act: CPI(M)
358.article_body: The CPI(M) has said that the Varanasi district court's decision to allow the petitions in the Gyanvapi Mosque case is a "clear violation" of the Places of Worship Act, 1991. "Wrong interpretations of the law...will lead to serious consequences," said the party. The court said the Act did not apply here as the idols were allegedly present in the mosque.

359.title: Audit  oxygen shortage COVID-19 deaths: Parliament panel to govt
359.article_body: A parliamentary committee has recommended that the Union Health Ministry "audit deaths due to oxygen shortage", especially during the COVID-19 second wave. The panel said it was "disturbed" by the ministry's "unfortunate denial" of COVID-19 deaths due to oxygen shortage. The committee added that it had warned the government of a possible shortage but they were given 'false assurances'.

360.title: Lineman drowns while trying to restore power hit by rains near B'luru
360.article_body: A lineman of Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) drowned in a lake while trying to restore power which got affected by heavy rains in Karnataka's Tumakuru district. The 38-year-old had to swim in the Tippur lake to reach the pole point. BESCOM has announced a compensation of ₹10 lakh for his family and a job for his wife.

361.title: 2 men hired for a paint job kill shopkeeper for ₹40,000 in Delhi
361.article_body: Two men, who were contracted by a shopkeeper in Delhi's Jamia Nagar to paint his house and shop, killed him for ₹40,000, police said on Tuesday. The accused during the investigation revealed that they saw the deceased had a balance of ₹40,000 in his online wallet, following which they stabbed him multiple times, said Esha Pandey, DCP (south-east district).

362.title: Thane woman arrested for abusive Facebook comments on Amruta Fadnavis
362.article_body: A Thane-based woman was arrested for allegedly making derogatory comments on a Facebook post by Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis's wife, Amruta Fadnavis. The accused allegedly used a fake Facebook account, by the name of Ganesh Kapoor, to use inappropriate language. Notably, Facebook had suspended the accused's original account for posting abusive content in 2021.

363.title: Cheers to amazing menu & location: Harnaaz on Priyanka's restaurant
363.article_body: Miss Universe Harnaaz Sandhu recently visited Priyanka Chopra's restaurant, Sona, in New York. Sandhu shared a picture on her Instagram Stories and wrote, "Cheers to amazing menu, staff and location." Harnaaz, who is in New York to attend the New York Fashion Week 2022, wore a long beige dress and high heels for her outing.

364.title: Julia Fox and her son wear matching outfits to New York Fashion Week
364.article_body: Model-actress Julia Fox matched her outfit with her 20-month-old son Valentino for a New York Fashion Week show, which was held on Friday. Fox wore a black pleather dress and thigh-high pointed boots, while her son wore a black romper and black Crocs. Fox shares her son with ex-husband Peter Artemiev.

365.title: Info provided by FB could support Myanmar war crimes allegations: UN
365.article_body: The head of the Independent Investigative Mechanism for Myanmar (IIMM) said Facebook handed over millions of items that could support genocide and war crime allegations. Myanmar is facing genocide charges at the International Court of Justice over a military crackdown on the Rohingya in 2017. Facebook has supported calls for accountability for crimes against Rohingya.

366.title: It was my mother's dream to see me on 'The Kapil Sharma Show': Gaurav Dubey
366.article_body: Comedian Gaurav Dubey, who plays a character named Roopmati on 'The Kapil Sharma Show', said in an interview that it was his mother's dream to see him on the show. He said Kapil Sharma is "amazing", adding that the 41-year-old actor-comedian teaches him "like a Guru". "I've a feeling that I'll learn a lot from my stint in...show," said Gaurav.

367.title: Alia Bhatt is the only person I feel competitive with: Varun Dhawan
367.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan said Alia Bhatt is the only person he feels competitive with. "With Alia Bhatt's smashing big openings, as a male actor, I seek inspiration from that and aspire to do it too as a performer," Varun added. He said the society needs to accept that "our female leads can also be bigger than heroes".

368.title: BJP MLA Eatala Rajender suspended from Telangana Assembly
368.article_body: The BJP MLA from Huzurabad, Eatala Rajender, has been suspended from the Telangana Legislative Assembly over his alleged objectionable remarks against Assembly Speaker Pocharam Srinivas Reddy. He has been suspended for the rest of the ongoing session of the House. Reportedly, Rajender had recently said that the Speaker should not be a robot in the hands of the CM.

369.title: Survey of private & RSS schools should be done: Owaisi on survey of madrassas
369.article_body: While reacting to the move to conduct a survey of madrassas in UP and Uttarakhand, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday said it's a targeted survey against the Muslim community. "Survey of private schools, missionary schools, government schools and RSS schools should happen. Doing a survey of unaided madrassas is a targeted survey and is wrong," he added.

370.title: We'll make it through this winter: Germany's Scholz on energy crisis
370.article_body: While speaking at an event in Berlin, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said new liquefied natural gas terminals will be ready for imports by 2023 end. "We will...be able to import all the gas we need independently of Russia," Scholz added. Government is seeking to ensure that some nuclear power plants can remain running until next spring to avoid energy bottlenecks.

371.title: SEBI has no role in new-age tech firms' IPO pricing: SEBI Chief
371.article_body: Referring to the pricing of the initial share sale of new-age technology companies, SEBI Chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch said, "Our view is simple at what price you chose to do your IPO is your business, we have no business to suggest otherwise." She added, "The days of the Controller of Capital Issue are long gone."

372.title: Police vehicle torched, stones pelted during BJP's protest march to Bengal Secretariat
372.article_body: A police vehicle was set on fire and stones were pelted at police teams during BJP's protest march to West Bengal Secretariat Nabanna in Kolkata on Tuesday. Police used water cannons and tear gas shells to disperse BJP workers. State BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar was arrested and several other party leaders were detained during the protest against the TMC government.

373.title: DMK MP has yet again spewed hatred against one community: K Annamalai
373.article_body: The BJP criticised DMK MP A Raja and condemned his controversial remarks made against Hinduism while addressing a function in Tamil Nadu's Namakkal last week. "Sorry state of political discourse in Tamil Nadu. DMK MP has yet again spewed hatred against one community with the sole aim of appeasing others," said Tamil Nadu BJP President K Annamalai.

374.title: Court’s ruling supports BJP’s narrative: Mufti on Gyanvapi case verdict
374.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Tuesday reacted to the Varanasi district court’s order in the Gyanvapi case. "BJP has failed to eliminate unemployment, poverty and inflation. So, they want to distract people's attention. The court's ruling supports…BJP’s narrative," Mufti added. The court on Monday ruled in favour of Hindu women's petition in Gyanvapi mosque case.

375.title: Noida authority to form panel to look into dog-related issues
375.article_body: The Noida authority is planning to form a committee comprising officials, residents and experts to look into issues related to pet and stray dogs in residential areas and apartment complexes, officials informed. The committee will also help enforce mandatory pet registration and come up with rules regarding pets and stray animals, the officials added.

376.title: Won’t spare anyone: Minister says B'luru IT companies encroached stormwater drains
376.article_body: Karnataka Revenue Minister R Ashoka has blamed the IT companies in Bengaluru for encroaching on stormwater drains. "More than 30 IT companies have encroached storm water drains, they were talking big, but many of these companies and builders have encroached," he said. "We won't spare anyone, no question of giving time to anyone," he added.

377.title: Revamped Hyd airport to be ready by 2023 with more flight services
377.article_body: The expansion work of the Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Hyderabad is likely to be completed by next year. More domestic and international flights will take off from the revamped airport. The airport will have 149 check-in counters and 44 immigration counters. It will be able to handle 34 million passengers per year.

378.title: William Ruto sworn in as Kenya's 5th President
378.article_body: William Ruto was sworn in as Kenya's fifth President on Tuesday following his narrow election win last month. The Supreme Court last week rejected losing candidate Raila Odinga's lawsuit challenging the election result. Ruto, who has been deputy President since 2013, takes over at a time of surging food and fuel prices, high unemployment and rising public debt.

379.title: PharmEasy parent may raise $250 mn from private equity firms: Report
379.article_body: General Atlantic (GA), Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPPIB) and Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) are considering investing about $250 million in PharmEasy's parent company API Holdings, as per a report. Existing investors like Temasek and ADQ will invest about $70-80 million through a convertible instrument. Bank of America and Morgan Stanley are its advisors for the fundraise.

380.title: Amazon Wholesale reports loss of ₹480 cr in FY22, revenue up 47%
380.article_body: Amazon's B2B arm, Amazon Wholesale (India), reported a net loss of ₹480 crore in FY22 as against a net profit of ₹43 crore in FY21. Its revenue surged by 47% to ₹4,605 crore in FY22 and its total expenses were ₹5,086 crore. Its operating revenue rose by 46.6% to ₹4,592 crore from ₹3,131.9 crore on a year-on-year basis.

381.title: 200 people attack Odisha police station over youth's detention, 8 policemen injured
381.article_body: A mob of around 200 people on Tuesday attacked a police station in Odisha's Gajapati district over a youth's detention for allegedly smuggling ganja, police said. "Protesters broke open the gate...thrashed personnel and ransacked properties. All of them were armed. At least seven to eight personnel were injured in the melee," a police officer added.

382.title: Don’t know why Babar was trying to stretch the match vs SL: Moin Khan
382.article_body: Ex-Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Moin Khan has questioned Babar Azam's captaincy in their Asia Cup 2022 final, stating that he played into Sri Lanka's hands by not setting an attacking field after reducing the Dasun Shanaka-led side to 58/5. "Don't know why he was trying to stretch the match," added Moin. Sri Lanka went on to post 170/6 in the match.

383.title: 25-yr-old woman, boyfriend arrested for killing her brother in Jharkhand
383.article_body: Police arrested a 25-year-old woman and her boyfriend on Monday for allegedly killing her 21-year-old brother in Jharkhand’s Ramgarh, police said. The mutilated body of the victim was exhumed by police on Sunday. The man was killed as he protested his sister’s relationship with the youth of another community, police stated.

384.title: Which 26 medicines have been removed by the govt from essential medicines list?
384.article_body: Health Ministry has released National List of Essential Medicines, 2022, comprising 384 drugs. The ministry has removed 26 drugs that were part of the previous NLEM, including Methyldopa, Atenolol, Alteplase, White Petrolatum, Cetrimide, Bleaching Powder, Sucralfate, Ranitidine, Erythromycin and Nicotinamide. Reasons for the deletion include safety concerns and alternatives with better efficacy.

385.title: 12-year-old Kerala boy attacked by stray dog as he rides bicycle, video surfaces
385.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was attacked by a stray dog in Kerala's Kozhikode on Sunday. A 50-second video of the attack shows the dog pouncing on the boy as he rides his bicycle and biting down on his wrist, refusing to let go. Notably, Kerala government will approach Supreme Court for permission to kill violent dogs after rise in dog attacks.

386.title: Used to feel envious of contemporaries when they were doing better work: Pavail
386.article_body: Actor Pavail Gulati, who starred in films like 'Dobaaraa' and 'Thappad', in an interview said, "I used to feel envious of my contemporaries when they were doing better work." He added that he feels "better" today because he's also doing "nicer work". "I'm working with people I...wanted to work with and even they're keen to work with me," said Pavail.

387.title: It's clear, England can win the Ashes next year: Michael Vaughan
387.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has said he's convinced that Ben Stokes-led England can win the Ashes next year. "At the start of April, if you had said they had a chance to win...Ashes next year, we would've said there was no way they could do it," added Vaughan. Under Stokes, England have won six of their seven Tests so far.

388.title: Debt-ridden farmer ends life in Maha's Nagpur, 5th death in a month
388.article_body: A 60-year-old debt-ridden farmer allegedly died by suicide in Maharashtra's Nagpur district after his crop got damaged due to heavy rains. Rajiv Baburao Judpe was found dead at his farm on Monday, police said. He reportedly owned 2.5 acres of land and had taken loan from a bank. Notably, this is the fifth such case in a month in Nagpur.

389.title: Noida residents to soon get e-cycles on rent
389.article_body: The Noida Authority will soon get about 620 electric bicycles at 62 docking stations across Noida, commencing the city's first public bike-sharing (PBS) system within the next three months. Two companies have been selected for the project and will manage different docking stations. Each station will have 10 cycles, but the number might increase depending on the demand.

390.title: German man jailed for life for killing cashier who told him to wear mask
390.article_body: A 50-year-old German man was jailed for life on Tuesday for shooting dead a petrol station cashier, who refused to sell him beer and demanded that he wear a face mask, in September 2021. The accused, Mario N, had turned himself in last year after police launched a large-scale manhunt. According to authorities, Mario said he'd acted "out of anger".

391.title: Bharti Telecom plans to raise ₹6,000 cr of debt via NCDs: Report
391.article_body: Bharti Airtel promoter Bharti Telecom is planning to raise ₹6,000 crore in debt through non-convertible debentures (NCDs) to buy the remaining 3.33% stake in Airtel sold by Singapore Telecommunications (Singtel), as per a report. Last week, Singtel sold 1.76% in Airtel, of which Bharti Telecom acquired 1.62%. The NCDs are expected to have between one and three-year maturities.

392.title: I follow Dr Ambedkar, I cultivate minds through my art: Ranjith
392.article_body: Filmmaker Pa Ranjith has said that he follows Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar. "He always said cultivation of the mind should be the ultimate aim of human existence. I'm doing it through my art," the filmmaker further added. Ranjith stated that films in India are not only an entertainment medium. Ranjith was named 'Filmmaker of the Decade' at the OTTplay Awards 2022.

393.title: 43 animals dead, 21 districts affected due to lumpy skin disease in Maha
393.article_body: About 43 cattle died and 21 districts have been affected due to lumpy skin disease in Maharashtra, the state's animal husbandry department said on Tuesday. The maximum deaths due to the disease were reported in Jalgaon at 17. While there are no restrictions on abattoirs in the state, illegal transport of cattle has been prohibited, the animal husbandry department stated.

394.title: Central Railway sets up e-vehicle charging facilities at 9 stations in Mumbai
394.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) has set up nine electric vehicle charging facilities in Mumbai. The stations where these facilities have been provided are - Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, Dadar, Byculla, Parel, Kurla, Lokmanya Tilak Terminus, Bhandup, Kalyan and Panvel. The charging facility will be functional 24 hours and is expected to augment infrastructure for EVs to operate smoothly, CR said.

395.title: Hyderabad gets 21-metre-long foot-over bridge with elevators at Kattedan
395.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) on Monday opened a new foot-over bridge to the public at Kattedan near Swapna Theatre in Rajendra Nagar Circle. The 21-metre-long bridge has two lifts that can carry 10 passengers each. "The facility will benefit around 5,000 persons daily and has eight CCTV cameras for their safety," Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal said during the inauguration.

396.title: Truck driver arrested from UP for morphing pics of 85 women with porn content
396.article_body: Faridabad Police have arrested a 42-year-old truck driver, Ganesh, from Uttar Pradesh for allegedly blackmailing 85 women by sending them their morphed photos superimposed with pornographic content and threatening to circulate the photos. Police said he blackmailed women for sexual favours and several women considered killing themselves. Police added they found 485 obscene videos in his phone.

397.title: Robbers cut BJP MLA's mother's ears to steal her gold earrings in UP
397.article_body: The 80-year-old mother of BJP MLA Pradeep Chaudhary, Santosh Devi, was robbed of her gold earrings in UP's Ghaziabad on Tuesday when she was on her morning walk. The robbers, who fled from the scene, cut her ears with a cutter, reports said. She was immediately taken to a nearby hospital and given first aid.

398.title: US marketing firm offers 10% hike to staff on notice period, Founder shares post
398.article_body: A marketing firm in the US offers its employees a 10% hike if they agree to serve at least six weeks’ notice period. Gorilla's Founder Jon Franko wrote on LinkedIn, "And we promise, no hard feelings. This encourages our people to do something different if they're feeling stuck...It also gives us time to prepare for how we'll move forward."

399.title: We'll be watching Tiafoe dominate in the years to come: Michelle Obama
399.article_body: The former First Lady of the US Michelle Obama took to Twitter to praise 24-year-old Frances Tiafoe for his recent performances. "I have a feeling we'll all be watching Tiafoe dominate in the years to come," she wrote on Twitter. Tiafoe became the first American man since 2006 to enter the semi-finals at the US Open in the recently-concluded edition.

400.title: After Narendra Modi, BJP planning to make Sonia Gandhi the PM: Kejriwal
400.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said after PM Narendra Modi, BJP is "planning to make [Congress chief] Sonia Gandhi the Prime Minister". "Do ask [BJP] this question that Sonia ji is being considered as a PM candidate for Modi ji's successor. What do they have to say about that?" Kejriwal said. "Congress is finished," he added.
